original: Majjhima Nikāya 88
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Bāhitikasutta
analyzed: bāhitika sutta
translated: With Bāhitika

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: Once the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sāvatthiyaṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya sāvatthiyam piṇḍāya pāvisi
translated: Then, when it was morning, the venerable Ānanda dressed, and taking his bowl and outer robe, went into Sāvatthī for alms.

original: Sāvatthiyaṁ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto yena pubbārāmo migāramātupāsādo tenupasaṅkami divāvihārāya.
analyzed: sāvatthiyam piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantaḥ yena pubbārāmaḥ migāra mātu pāsādaḥ tena upasaṅkami divāvihārāya
translated: When he had walked for alms in Sāvatthī and had returned from his alms round, after his meal he went to the Eastern Park, to the Palace of Migāra’s Mother for the day’s abiding.

original: Tena kho pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalo ekapuṇḍarīkaṁ nāgaṁ abhiruhitvā sāvatthiyā niyyāti divā divassa.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ ekapuṇḍarīkam nāgam abhiruhitvā sāvatthiyā niyyāti divā divassa
translated: Now on that occasion King Pasenadi of Kosala had mounted the elephant Ekapundarika and was riding out from Sāvatthī in the middle of the day.

original: Addasā kho rājā pasenadi kosalo āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ.
analyzed: addasā khalu rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ āyasmantam ānandam āgacchanta
translated: He saw the venerable Ānanda coming in the distance.

original: Disvāna sirivaḍḍhaṁ mahāmattaṁ āmantesi:🔽“āyasmā no eso, samma sirivaḍḍha, ānando”ti.
analyzed: disvāna sirivaḍḍham mahāmattam āmantesi  āyasmai naḥ esaḥ samma sirivaḍḍhaḥ ānandaḥ ti
translated: Seeing him, he addressed the chief minister Sirivaḍḍha: 🔽“That, my good Sirivaḍḍha, is the venerable Ānanda.”

original: “Evaṁ, mahārāja, āyasmā eso ānando”ti.
analyzed: eva mahā rāja āyasmai ānandaḥ iti
translated: “Yes, sire, that is the venerable Ānanda.”

original: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo aññataraṁ purisaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ aññataram purisam āmantesi
translated: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala told a man,🔽“Come, good man, go to the venerable Ānanda,

original: “ehi tvaṁ, ambho purisa, yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena āyasmato ānandassa pāde sirasā vandāhi:
analyzed: ehi tva ambho purisa yena āyasmataḥ ānandaḥ tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena āyasmataḥ ānandassa pāde sirasā vandāhi
translated: bow down in my name with your head at his feet,🔽and say:

original: ‘rājā, bhante, pasenadi kosalo āyasmato ānandassa pāde sirasā vandatī’ti;
analyzed: rājā bhante pasenadi kosalaḥ āyasmataḥ ānandassa pāde sirasā vandati iti
translated: ‘Venerable sir, King Pasenadi of Kosala bows down with his head at the feet of the venerable Ānanda

original: evañca vadehi:
analyzed: evañca vadehi
translated: and says this:

original: ‘sace kira, bhante, āyasmato ānandassa na kiñci accāyikaṁ karaṇīyaṁ, āgametu kira, bhante, āyasmā ānando muhuttaṁ anukampaṁ upādāyā’”ti.
analyzed: sace kira bhante āyasmataḥ ānandassa na kiñci accāyikam karaṇīyaḥ āgametu kira bhante āyasmai ānandaḥ muhuttam anukampam upādāya ati
translated: If the venerable Ānanda has nothing more to do, may he consent to come to the royal palace. It would be good if the venerable Ānanda would take pity on me and come.’”

original: “Evaṁ, devā”ti kho so puriso rañño pasenadissa kosalassa paṭissutvā yenāyasmā ānando🔽tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ
analyzed: eva deva ati kho so purisaḥ rañño pasenadissa kosalassa paṭissutvā yena ayasmai ānando  tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam ānandam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi ekamanta
translated: Responding, “As you say, your majesty,” to the king, the man went to the venerable Ānanda

original: ṭhito kho so puriso āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: ṭhitaḥ kho saḥ purisaḥ āyasmantam ānandam etat avoca
translated: and, on arrival, having bowed down to him, stood to one side. As he was standing there, he said to the venerable Ānanda,🔽“Master Ānanda, King Pasenadi of Kosala bows down with his head at your feet and says this:

original: “rājā, bhante, pasenadi kosalo āyasmato ānandassa pāde sirasā vandati;
analyzed: rājā bhante pasenadi kosalaḥ āyasmataḥ ānandassa pāde sirasā vandati
translated: “Venerable Ānanda, King Pasenadi of Kosala bows down at your feet.

original: evañca vadeti:
analyzed: evañca vada iti
translated: He says this:

original: ‘sace kira, bhante, āyasmato ānandassa na kiñci accāyikaṁ karaṇīyaṁ, āgametu kira, bhante, āyasmā ānando muhuttaṁ anukampaṁ upādāyā’”ti.
analyzed: sace kira bhante āyasmataḥ ānandassa na kiñci accāyikam karaṇīyaḥ āgametu kira bhante āyasmai ānandaḥ muhuttam anukampam upādāya ati
translated: ‘If there’s nothing urgent to do, may the Venerable Ānanda please wait a moment out of compassion.’”

original: Adhivāsesi kho āyasmā ānando tuṇhībhāvena.
analyzed: adhivāsesi kho āyasmai ānandaḥ tuṇhībhāvena
translated: Ānanda consented in silence.

original: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo yāvatikā nāgassa bhūmi nāgena gantvā nāgā paccorohitvā
analyzed: atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ yāvatikā nāgassa bhūmi nāgena gantvā nāgā paccorohitvā
translated: Then, after traveling by elephant as far as the terrain allowed, King Pasenadi got down from his elephant

original: pattikova yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ abhivādetvā
analyzed: pattikaḥ uva yena āyasmai ānandaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam ānandam abhivādetvā
translated: and, on foot, approached Ānanda. He bowed,

original: ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho rājā pasenadi kosalo āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: ekamantam aṭṭhāsi ekamantam ṭhitaḥ kho rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ āyasmantam ānandam etat avoca
translated: and then stood to one side. He said to Ānanda,

original: “sace, bhante, āyasmato ānandassa na kiñci accāyikaṁ karaṇīyaṁ, sādhu, bhante, āyasmā ānando yena aciravatiyā nadiyā tīraṁ tenupasaṅkamatu anukampaṁ upādāyā”ti.
analyzed: sace bhante āyasmataḥ ānandassa na kiñci accāyikam sādhu bhante āyasmai ānandaḥ yena aciravatiyāḥ nadiyāḥ tīram tena upasaṅkamatu anukampam upādāya ati
translated: “If there’s nothing urgent to do, it would be good if the Venerable Ānanda would approach the bank of the river Aciravatī out of compassion.”

original: Adhivāsesi kho āyasmā ānando tuṇhībhāvena.
analyzed: adhivāsesi kho āyasmai ānandaḥ tuṇhībhāvena
translated: The venerable Ānanda consented in silence.

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena aciravatiyā nadiyā tīraṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle paññatte āsane nisīdi.🔽Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo yāvatikā nāgassa bhūmi nāgena gantvā nāgā paccorohitvā🔽pattikova yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ abhivādetvā
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ yena aciravatiyāḥ nadiyāḥ tīram tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā aññatarasmim rukkha mūle paññatte āsane nisīdi  atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ yāvatikā nāgassa bhūmi nāgena gantvā nāgā paccorohitvā  pattikaḥ uva yena āyasmai ānandaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantam ānandam abhivādetvā
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda went to the bank of the river Aciravatī, and after going, he sat down at the root of a certain tree on a seat made ready.🔽Then King Pasenadi of Kosala went as far as the ground for vehicles, and after going as far as the ground for vehicles, he dismounted from his vehicle and went on foot to the venerable Ānanda. After going and paying homage to the venerable Ānanda,🔽he stood at one side

original: ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho rājā pasenadi kosalo āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: ekamantam aṭṭhāsi ekamantam ṭhitaḥ kho rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ āyasmantam ānandam etat avoca
translated: and said to him:

original: “idha, bhante, āyasmā ānando hatthatthare nisīdatū”ti.
analyzed: idha bhante āyasmai ānandaḥ hatthatthare nisīdatu uti
translated: “Venerable sir, let the venerable Ānanda sit down on the couch.”

original: “Alaṁ, mahārāja.
analyzed: ala mahā rāja
translated: “Enough, great king.

original: Nisīda tvaṁ;
analyzed: nisīda tva
translated: You sit down;

original: nisinno ahaṁ sake āsane”ti.🔽Nisīdi kho rājā pasenadi kosalo paññatte āsane.
analyzed: nisinnaḥ aham sake āsane iti  nisīdi kho rājā pasenadi kosalo paññatte āsane
translated: I am sitting on my own seat.”🔽King Pasenadi of Kosala sat down on a seat made ready🔽and said to the venerable Ānanda:

original: Nisajja kho rājā pasenadi kosalo āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: nisajja khalu rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ āyasmantam ānandam etat avoca
translated: “Venerable sir, it is said, ‘Nibbāna, Nibbāna.’

original: “kiṁ nu kho, bhante ānanda, so bhagavā tathārūpaṁ kāyasamācāraṁ samācareyya, yvāssa kāyasamācāro opārambho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehī”ti?
analyzed: kim nu khalu bhante ānanda saḥ bhagavā tathārūpam kāya samācāram samācareyya yvā assa kāya samācāraḥ opārambhaḥ samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi iti
translated: “But, reverend Ānanda, would the Lord have conducted himself in such a way as to be open to criticism by recluses and brahmins?”

original: “Na kho, mahārāja, so bhagavā tathārūpaṁ kāyasamācāraṁ samācareyya, yvāssa kāyasamācāro opārambho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhī”ti.🔽“Kiṁ pana, bhante ānanda, so bhagavā tathārūpaṁ vacīsamācāraṁ …pe…🔽manosamācāraṁ samācareyya, yvāssa manosamācāro opārambho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehī”ti?
analyzed: na kho mahā rāja saḥ bhagavā tathārūpam kāya samācāram samācareyya yvā assa kāya samācāraḥ opārambhaḥ samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi iti  kim pana bhante ānanda saḥ bhagavā tathārūpam vacī samācāram pe  manaḥ samācāram samācareyya yvā assa manaḥ samācāraḥ opārambhaḥ samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi iti
translated: “No, sire.”🔽“But, reverend Ānanda, would the Lord have conducted himself in such a way as to be open to criticism by recluses and brahmins in regard to speech and mind?”

original: “Na kho, mahārāja, so bhagavā tathārūpaṁ manosamācāraṁ samācareyya, yvāssa manosamācāro opārambho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhī”ti.
analyzed: na kho mahā rāja saḥ bhagavā tathārūpam manaḥ samācāram samācareyya yvā assa manaḥ samācāraḥ opārambhaḥ samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi iti
translated: “No, sire.”

original: “Acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ, bhante.
analyzed: acchariya bhante abbhuta bhante
translated: “It is wonderful, reverend Ānanda, it is marvellous!

original: Yañhi mayaṁ, bhante, nāsakkhimhā pañhena paripūretuṁ taṁ, bhante, āyasmatā ānandena pañhassa veyyākaraṇena paripūritaṁ.
analyzed: yat hi maya bhante na asakkhimhā pañhena paripūretum ta bhante āyasmatā ānandena pañhassa veyyākaraṇena paripūrita
translated: For we were not able to fill up the Blessed One’s question, but the venerable Ānanda has filled up the Blessed One’s question with his answer.

original: Ye te, bhante, bālā abyattā ananuvicca apariyogāhetvā paresaṁ vaṇṇaṁ vā avaṇṇaṁ vā bhāsanti, na mayaṁ taṁ sārato paccāgacchāma;
analyzed: ye te bhante bālāḥ abyattāḥ an anuvicca a pariyogāhetvā paresam vaṇṇam vā avaṇṇam vā bhāsanti na mayam tam sārataḥ paccāgacchāma
translated: “We do not accept the praise or criticism of those who are foolish, inexperienced, and undiscerning.

original: ye pana te, bhante, paṇḍitā viyattā medhāvino anuvicca pariyogāhetvā paresaṁ vaṇṇaṁ vā avaṇṇaṁ vā bhāsanti, mayaṁ taṁ sārato paccāgacchāma.
analyzed: ye pana te bhante paṇḍitāḥ viyattāḥ medhāvinaḥ anuvicca pariyogāhetvā paresam vaṇṇam vā avaṇṇam vā bhāsanti mayam tam sārataḥ paccāgacchāma
translated: We accept the praise or criticism of those who are wise, experienced, and discerning.

original: Katamo pana, bhante ānanda, kāyasamācāro opārambho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhī”ti?
analyzed: katamaḥ pana bhante ānanda kāya samācāraḥ opārambhaḥ samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi iti
translated: “But, Venerable Ānanda, what kind of bodily behavior is censured by wise spiritual practitioners and brahmins?”

original: “Yo kho, mahārāja, kāyasamācāro akusalo”.
analyzed: yaḥ khalu mahā rāja kāya samācāraḥ akusalaḥ
translated: “Bodily behavior that is unskillful, great king.”

original: “Katamo pana, bhante, kāyasamācāro akusalo”?
analyzed: katamaḥ pana bhante kāya samācāraḥ akusalaḥ
translated: “But, Venerable Ānanda, what kind of bodily behavior is unskillful?”

original: “Yo kho, mahārāja, kāyasamācāro sāvajjo”.
analyzed: yaḥ khalu mahā rāja kāya samācāraḥ sa avajjaḥ
translated: “Bodily behavior that is blameworthy, great king.”

original: “Katamo pana, bhante, kāyasamācāro sāvajjo”?
analyzed: katamaḥ pana bhante kāya samācāraḥ sāvajjaḥ
translated: “But, Venerable Ānanda, what kind of bodily behavior is blameworthy?”

original: “Yo kho, mahārāja, kāyasamācāro sabyābajjho”.
analyzed: yaḥ kho mahā rāja kāya samācāraḥ sa byābajjhaḥ
translated: “Bodily behavior that is harmful, great king.”

original: “Katamo pana, bhante, kāyasamācāro sabyābajjho”?
analyzed: katamaḥ pana bhante kāya samācāraḥ sa byābajjhaḥ
translated: “But, Venerable Ānanda, what kind of bodily behavior is harmful?”

original: “Yo kho, mahārāja, kāyasamācāro dukkhavipāko”.
analyzed: yaḥ kho mahā rāja kāya samācāraḥ dukkha vipākaḥ
translated: “Bodily behavior that has painful consequences, great king.”

original: “Katamo pana, bhante, kāyasamācāro dukkhavipāko”?
analyzed: katamaḥ pana bhante kāya samācāraḥ dukkha vipāko
translated: “But what, revered sir, is bodily conduct that has suffering as its outcome?”

original: “Yo kho, mahārāja, kāyasamācāro attabyābādhāyapi saṁvattati, parabyābādhāyapi saṁvattati, ubhayabyābādhāyapi saṁvattati.
analyzed: yaḥ khalu mahā rāja kāya samācāraḥ atta byābādhāya api savattati para byābādhāya api savattati ubhaya byābādhāya api savattati
translated: “That bodily conduct, great king, which leads to one’s own affliction, or to the affliction of others, or to the affliction of both,

original: Tassa akusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhanti, kusalā dhammā parihāyanti;
analyzed: tassa akusalāḥ dhammāḥ abhivaḍḍhanti kusalāḥ dhammā parihāyanti
translated: and by which unwholesome states increase and wholesome states diminish:

original: evarūpo kho, mahārāja, kāyasamācāro opārambho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhī”ti.
analyzed: evarūpaḥ kho mahā rāja kāya samācāraḥ opārambhaḥ samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi iti
translated: Such bodily conduct is censured by wise recluses and brahmins.”

original: “Katamo pana, bhante ānanda, vacīsamācāro …pe…
analyzed: katamaḥ pana bhante ānanda vacī samācāraḥ pe
translated: “But what, revered sir, is verbal conduct …

original: manosamācāro opārambho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhī”ti?
analyzed: manaḥ samācāraḥ opārambho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi iti
translated: mental conduct that is censured by wise recluses and brahmins?”

original: “Yo kho, mahārāja, manosamācāro akusalo”.
analyzed: yaḥ khalu mahā rāja manaḥ samācāraḥ akusalaḥ
translated: “That mental conduct, great king, which is unwholesome.”

original: “Katamo pana, bhante, manosamācāro akusalo”?
analyzed: katamaḥ pana bhante manaḥ samācāraḥ akusalo
translated: “But what, revered sir, is unwholesome mental conduct?”

original: “Yo kho, mahārāja, manosamācāro sāvajjo”.
analyzed: yaḥ khalu mahā rāja manaḥ samācāraḥ sa avajjaḥ
translated: “That mental conduct, great king, which is reprehensible.”

original: “Katamo pana, bhante, manosamācāro sāvajjo”?
analyzed: katamaḥ pana bhante manaḥ samācāraḥ sāvajjaḥ
translated: “But what, revered sir, is reprehensible mental conduct?”

original: “Yo kho, mahārāja, manosamācāro sabyābajjho”.
analyzed: yaḥ kho mahā rāja manaḥ samācāraḥ sa byābajjhaḥ

analyzed: yaḥ kho mahā rāja manaḥ samācāraḥ dukkha vipākaḥ

analyzed: yaḥ khalu mahā rāja manaḥ samācāraḥ atta byābādhāya api savattati para byābādhāya api savattati ubhaya byābādhāya api savattati
translated: “Any bodily conduct, sire, that leads to one’s own affliction, or to the affliction of others, or to the affliction of both,

analyzed: tassa akusalāḥ dhammāḥ abhivaḍḍhanti kusalāḥ dhammā parihāyanti

translated: such bodily conduct, sire, is reprehensible to the wise, to recluses and brahmins.”

original: “Kiṁ nu kho, bhante ānanda, so bhagavā sabbesaṁyeva akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānaṁ vaṇṇetī”ti?
analyzed: kim nu kho bhante ānanda saḥ bhagavā sabbesayā iva akusalānam dhammānam pahānam vaṇṇeti iti
translated: “But, revered Ananda, does the Blessed One praise the abandoning of all unwholesome states?”

original: “Sabbākusaladhammapahīno kho, mahārāja, tathāgato kusaladhammasamannāgato”ti.
analyzed: sabba akusala dhamma pahīnaḥ kho mahā rāja tathāgataḥ kusala dhamma samannāgataḥ ti
translated: “The Tathāgata, sire, is one who has abandoned all unwholesome states and is endowed with wholesome states.”

translated: “Any verbal conduct that does not lead to one’s own affliction, or to the affliction of others, or to the affliction of both;

analyzed: evarūpaḥ kho mahā rāja manaḥ samācāraḥ an upārambhaḥ samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi iti
translated: Such verbal conduct is not offensive to the wise, to spiritual practitioners, or to ascetics.”

original: “Kiṁ pana, bhante ānanda, so bhagavā sabbesaṁyeva kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ upasampadaṁ vaṇṇetī”ti?
analyzed: kim pana bhante ānanda saḥ bhagavā sabbesayā iva kusalānam dhammānam upasampadam vaṇṇeti iti
translated: “But, revered sir, does the Lord recommend the attainment of all wholesome states?”

original: “Sabbākusaladhammapahīno kho, mahārāja, tathāgato kusaladhammasamannāgato”ti.
analyzed: sabba akusala dhamma pahīnaḥ kho mahā rāja tathāgataḥ kusala dhamma samannāgataḥ ti
translated: “The Tathagata, sire, is free from all unwholesome states and is endowed with all wholesome states.”

original: “Acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ, bhante.
analyzed: acchariya bhante abbhuta bhante
translated: “It is wonderful, revered sir, it is marvellous

original: Yāva subhāsitañcidaṁ, bhante, āyasmatā ānandena.🔽Iminā ca mayaṁ, bhante, āyasmato ānandassa subhāsitena attamanābhiraddhā.
analyzed: bhante āyasmatā ānandena  iminā ca bhante āyasmataḥ ānandassa su bhāsitena atta manā abhiraddhā
translated: how well that has been expressed by the venerable Ananda.

original: Evaṁ attamanābhiraddhā ca mayaṁ, bhante, āyasmato ānandassa subhāsitena.🔽Sace, bhante, āyasmato ānandassa hatthiratanaṁ kappeyya, hatthiratanampi mayaṁ āyasmato ānandassa dadeyyāma.
analyzed: evam atta manāḥ abhiraddhā ca bhante āyasmataḥ ānandassa su bhāsitena  sace bhante āyasmataḥ ānandassa hatthi ratanam kappeyya hatthi ratanam pi mayam āyasmataḥ ānandassa dadeyyāma
translated: And we are satisfied and pleased by the venerable Ananda’s eloquent words.🔽And we would show our satisfaction and pleasure by giving the venerable Ananda🔽if the elephant treasure were suitable, we would give the elephant treasure to the venerable Ananda.

original: Sace, bhante, āyasmato ānandassa assaratanaṁ kappeyya, assaratanampi mayaṁ āyasmato ānandassa dadeyyāma.
analyzed: sace bhante āyasmataḥ ānandassa assa ratanam kappeyya assa ratanam pi mayam āyasmataḥ ānandassa dadeyyāma
translated: If the horse treasure were suitable, we would give the horse treasure to the venerable Ananda.

original: Sace, bhante, āyasmato ānandassa gāmavaraṁ kappeyya, gāmavarampi mayaṁ āyasmato ānandassa dadeyyāma.
analyzed: sace bhante āyasmataḥ ānandassa gām avaram kappeyya gām avaram pi mayam āyasmataḥ ānandassa dadeyyāma
translated: If the venerable Ānanda would accept a village, we would give him a village.

original: Api ca, bhante, mayampetaṁ jānāma:
analyzed: api ca bhante mayampetam jānāma
translated: But, venerable sir, we know this:

original: ‘netaṁ āyasmato ānandassa kappatī’ti.
analyzed: na itam āyasmataḥ ānandassa kappati iti
translated: ‘This is not proper for the venerable Ānanda.’

original: Ayaṁ me, bhante, bāhitikā raññā māgadhena ajātasattunā vedehiputtena vatthanāḷiyā pakkhipitvā pahitā soḷasasamā āyāmena, aṭṭhasamā vitthārena.
analyzed: ayam me bhante bāhitikā raññā māgadhena ajātasattunā vedehiputtena vattha nāḷiyā pakkhipitvā pahitā soḷasa samā āyāmena aṭṭha samā vitthārena
translated: This cloak, venerable sir, was sent to me by King Ajātasattu of Magadha, the son of the Videhi lady, in a golden casket borne on the head of a man. It is sixteen cubits long and eight cubits wide.

original: Taṁ, bhante, āyasmā ānando paṭiggaṇhātu anukampaṁ upādāyā”ti.
analyzed: ta bhante āyasmai ānandaḥ paṭiggaṇhātu anukampam upādāya ati
translated: May the venerable Ānanda accept it out of compassion for me.”

original: “Alaṁ, mahārāja, paripuṇṇaṁ me ticīvaran”ti.
analyzed: ala mahā rāja paripuṇṇam me ti cīvaranti
translated: “Enough, great king, my triple robe is complete.”

original: “Ayaṁ, bhante, aciravatī nadī diṭṭhā āyasmatā ceva ānandena amhehi ca.
analyzed: bhante aciravatī nadī diṭṭhā āyasmatā ca iva ānandena amhehi ca
translated: “Venerable sir, the Aciravatī River has been seen by the venerable Ānanda and by us.

original: Yadā uparipabbate mahāmegho abhippavuṭṭho hoti, athāyaṁ aciravatī nadī ubhato kūlāni saṁvissandantī gacchati;
analyzed: yadā upari pabbate mahā meghaḥ abhippavuṭṭhaḥ hoti atha ayam aciravatī nadī ubhatas kūlāni sa vissandantī gacchati
translated: When a great cloud has rained heavily on the mountains, then the Aciravatī River overflows both its banks;

original: evameva kho, bhante, āyasmā ānando imāya bāhitikāya attano ticīvaraṁ karissati.
analyzed: evam eva kho bhante āyasmai ānandaḥ imāya bāhitikāya attano ti cīvaram karissati
translated: so too, venerable sir, the venerable Ānanda will make his triple robe with this cloak.

original: Yaṁ panāyasmato ānandassa purāṇaṁ ticīvaraṁ taṁ sabrahmacārīhi saṁvibhajissati.
analyzed: yam pana āyasmataḥ ānandassa purāṇam ti cīvaram tam sabrahmacārīhi sa vibhajissati
translated: But he will share his old set of three robes with his fellow monks.

original: Evāyaṁ amhākaṁ dakkhiṇā saṁvissandantī maññe gamissati.
analyzed: eva ayam amhākam dakkhiṇā sa vissandantī maññe gamissati
translated: In this way, our offering will be distributed to many.

original: Paṭiggaṇhātu, bhante, āyasmā ānando bāhitikan”ti.
analyzed: paṭiggaṇhātu bhante āyasmai ānandaḥ bāhitikam ti
translated: Venerable Ānanda should accept the woolen cloak.”

original: Paṭiggahesi kho āyasmā ānando bāhitikaṁ.
analyzed: paṭiggahesi kho āyasman ānandaḥ bāhitika
translated: Ānanda accepted the woolen cloak.

original: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ āyasmantam ānandam etat avoca
translated: Then King Pasenadi said to him,

original: “handa ca dāni mayaṁ, bhante ānanda, gacchāma;
analyzed: handa ca dāni maya bhante ānanda gacchāma
translated: “Now, Sir, we must go.

original: bahukiccā mayaṁ bahukaraṇīyā”ti.
analyzed: bahu kitcā mayam bahu karaṇīyā ati
translated: We have many duties and much work.”

original: “Yassadāni tvaṁ, mahārāja, kālaṁ maññasī”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ sadāni tva mahā rāja kālam maññasi iti
translated: “Now is the time, Great King, to do as you think fit.”

original: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo āyasmato ānandassa bhāsitaṁ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ āyasmataḥ ānandassa bhāsitam abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā āyasmantam ānandam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkāmi
translated: After rejoicing in and approving of the words of Ānanda, King Pasenadi got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated Ānanda with his right side toward him, and left.

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando acirapakkantassa rañño pasenadissa kosalassa yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmā ānandaḥ acira pakkantassa raññaḥ pasenadissa kosalassa yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: Soon after the king had left, Ven. Ānanda went to the Blessed One and, on arrival, bowed down to him and sat to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando yāvatako ahosi raññā pasenadinā kosalena saddhiṁ kathāsallāpo taṁ sabbaṁ bhagavato ārocesi.
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho āyasmai ānandaḥ yāvatakaḥ ahosi raññā pasenadinā kosalena saddhim kathā sallāpo tam sabbam bhagavataḥ ārocesi
translated: As he was sitting there, he told the Blessed One his entire conversation with King Pasenadi Kosala.

original: Tañca bāhitikaṁ bhagavato pādāsi.
analyzed: tat ca bāhitikam bhagavataḥ
translated: He then offered the betel to the Blessed One.

original: Atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the monks,

original: “lābhā, bhikkhave, rañño pasenadissa kosalassa, suladdhalābhā, bhikkhave, rañño pasenadissa kosalassa;
analyzed: lābhāḥ bhikkhave rañño pasenadissa kosalassa su laddha lābhāḥ bhikkhave rañño pasenadissa kosalassa
translated: “Monks, it’s a gain for King Pasenadi Kosala, it’s a great gain for King Pasenadi Kosala

original: yaṁ rājā pasenadi kosalo labhati ānandaṁ dassanāya, labhati payirupāsanāyā”ti.
analyzed: yam rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ labhati ānandam dassanāya labhati payirupāsanāya ati
translated: that he gets to see Ānanda and to pay homage to him.”

original: Idamavoca bhagavā.
analyzed: idam avoca bhagavān
translated: This is the text of the discourse on Ānanda.

original: Attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandunti.🔽Bāhitikasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ aṭṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: attamanāḥ te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinandunti 🔽bāhitika suttam niṭṭhitam aṭṭhama
translated: The monks were satisfied and delighted in the Blessed One’s words.
